definition: to stop on the way for a rest
to rest/to take a break/to stop/to halt/(dialect) to sleep/a moment/a short while
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role

sentences.english: It was a stopping point on the famous Silk Road between the East and the West .
sentences.chinese: 當時它是連接東西方的著名絲綢之路上的一個歇腳點。

sentences.english: She decided to stop and ask if she could rest there for the night.
sentences.chinese: 她決定停下來，問一問是否能在這裏過夜歇歇腳。

sentences.english: I stopped at an old log hotel to quench a desert thirst.
sentences.chinese: 爲了緩解沙漠之渴，我來到了一家木屋旅館歇腳。

sentences.english: The oak bench was not just a foot rest.
sentences.chinese: 橡木長椅不僅僅是歇腳的地方。

sentences.english: If the pin is available only to, it can also sit in the shade of coffee Lane.
sentences.chinese: 如果只是想歇歇腳，那還可以到咖啡店裏坐坐。

sentences.english: The period of Shangyuan is a rest stop for Du Fu in his late years of vagrant life.
sentences.chinese: 上元年間，是杜甫晚年漂泊生涯中的一個歇腳期。

sentences.english: They stopped at a little cafe and had a fondue.
sentences.chinese: 他們在一家小餐館歇腳，吃了頓乾酪火鍋。

sentences.english: We found a perch on the ruins of a low stone wall.
sentences.chinese: 我們找到一處矮石牆的殘垣，歇了歇腳。

sentences.english: I don't need much now, just a place to rest.
sentences.chinese: 現在我什麼也不需要，只想找個地方歇歇腳。

sentences.english: Rose: Honey, mother needs a perch.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的，媽媽需要一個歇腳的地方。

definition: to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]
tearoom/canteen/cafeteria
Yancheng district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan
lonely/secluded
downtown
to go sightseeing/to spend one's leisure time wandering around
to eat one's fill/to be full
to reminisce/to talk about former times
comfortable niche
you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted
to drive a cart
brightly lit
packed with people/overcrowded/overpopulation
variant of 櫃檯|柜台[gui4 tai2]
desolate and uninhabited (idiom)
historical remains/historic monuments
